titles.title: Immigration Amendments of 1988

A bill to extend for 2 years section 314 of the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, to make additional visas available to immigrants from underrepresented countries to enhance diversity in immigration, and to extend through December 31, 1989, H-1 nonimmigrant status for certain registered nurses.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.

bill.summary: 9/30/1988--Introduced. Immigration Amendments of 1988 - Amends the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986 to extend through FY 1990 (at increased levels) additional visas for nonpreference immigrants. Makes specified numbers of visas available in FY 1990 and 1991 to immigrants from underrepresented countries (as defined by this Act). Extends H-1 status for certain registered nurses through December 31, 1989.
